column1: O2 device plan is a SCAM!,
column2:
["
So guys if any of you ordered an iPhone XS Max brand new when they were released, make sure you weren't overcharged!! I was overcharged by £158 as the retail of my version was £1249 at the time on Apple themselves, however the device plan was £1407.99 on o2 which they have refused to rectify. I have put in a complaint to o2 which will hopefully be sorted, but did threaten them with the ombudsman, which they got scared of and assured me o2s complaints would get a good outcome. So check!! If you have a Xs Max 256gb check you were not charged over 1249. Or at most any more than 1300!!!
", '
Well, good luck with that. Do let us know the outcome\xa0@Ebritton14\xa0

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

', '
@Ebritton14\xa0I'm afraid this "scam" as you call it is perfectly legal.O2 or any other retailer have the right to charge whatever they choose for a device as long as the price is clearly displayed.O2 provide all pricing information at the point of sale.Yes it's more than Apple charge, but it's not a scam.

	I have no affiliation whatsoever with O2 or any subsidiary companies. Comments posted are entirely of my own opinion. This is not Customer Service so we are unable to help with account specific issues.Currently using:OnePlus 6 (O2 & Sfr), Z3 Tablet (Three UK), iPhone 8+ (EE)

', '
Funnily enough I watched Watchdog last night and they did a piece on the worst network based on coverage and price. O2 and EE were the worst overall. Coverage was middle of the table, but price was bottom being the highest. Tesco came top. Funny that, as they run on the O2 network....

Veritas Numquam Perit

', '
			
				
					
					
						Hello @Ebritton14Sorry you feel so aggrieved. Hope you can get some satisfaction from your complaint.I do a lot of pricing research before I commit to a purchase of anything, I find then I can make informed decisions even if I choose to take a higher offer for different reasons.Good luck JAZZ
', "
With O2 you do get Refresh, Open discount and Priority....Refresh tariffs are the main reason people go for O2, and the chance to upgrade early. Each to their own choice though.I am lucky enough to have my own phone bought outright, so am Sim only. I wait until there is a sale or offer on and usually get a better deal than the one I'm on currently.

Veritas Numquam Perit

", '
			
				
					
					
						Thanks for all the replies guys, next time I will do more research into the prices. The thing that gets me is I went into an o2 store before I did the upgrade and they told me that the price of the device is never more than the retail price which is what makes their plans so good. Next year I am definitely not going to bother upgrading my other line, I’m looking into other networks
					
				
			
			
				
			
			
				
			
			
			
			
			
			
		', '
			
				
					
					
						What you were told was definitely a lie as they are always higher than RRP unless they are older models that are being discounted.
					
				
			
			
				
	I have no affiliation whatsoever with O2 or any subsidiary companies. Comments posted are entirely of my own opinion. This is not Customer Service so we are unable to help with account specific issues.Currently using:OnePlus 6 (O2 & Sfr), Z3 Tablet (Three UK), iPhone 8+ (EE)

', '
			
				
					
					
						I know it’s legal... the thing is though in the o2 store I was assured the price isn’t more than what it is in retail stores such as Apple. And also at the time i could not find the pricing anywhere. And even now it’s still extremely difficult, you should be able to see it without clicking anything
					
				
			
			
				
			
			
				
			
			
			
			
			
			
		', '
			
				
					
					
						Good luck with whatever you decide to do @Ebritton14JAZZ
					
				
			
			
				
			
			
				
			
			
			
			
			
			
		', "
So guys if any of you ordered an iPhone XS Max brand new when they were released, make sure you weren't overcharged!! I was overcharged by £158 as the retail of my version was £1249 at the time on Apple themselves, however the device plan was £1407.99 on o2 which they have refused to rectify. I have put in a complaint to o2 which will hopefully be sorted, but did threaten them with the ombudsman, which they got scared of and assured me o2s complaints would get a good outcome. So check!! If you have a Xs Max 256gb check you were not charged over 1249. Or at most any more than 1300!!!
", '
			
				
					
					
						Heard back from the complaints, basically, they said since that’s the price they paid for the phone which makes no sense surely if they are bulk buying it’s cheaper???? But because that’s the price o2 paid, they won’t do anything. It’s fine it’s them who’s loosing a customer when it comes to upgrade time next year, and the year after for another line.
					
				
			
			
				
			
			
				
			
			
			
			
			
			
		', '
Exactly as expected. You will more than likely find that most networks charge over the RRP and it does pay to check when renewing or taking out a contract with any of them.

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

']

column1: Out-of-date webpages on O2 - O2 Ts&Cs still contain references to "O2 Home"
column2:
["
Another section of the website that references a discontinued service,\xa0@Marjo, @Martin-O2 and\xa0@EmilieT:https://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/privacy-policy..Your smartphone might also have a Global Positioning System (GPS) location, that's used by your phone and certain apps. It's more accurate than network location alone, because it uses satellites. If you're using some of our apps, like Priority Moments, or apps connected to O2 Home we, or our partners, might collect some of your GPS location information...Look at markets, write reports or carry out research and number crunching. And, if the law allows it, look at information about you (including the calls you make, your spending, what you use the internet for and where you are when you do it). In the case of O2 Home, this includes things like the settings on your O2 Home equipment and when your O2 Home sensors are triggered...O2 Home customers should log in to My Account...O2 Home customers can opt out by calling us on 0344 499 0202. \xa0We’re open Mon-Sat, 8am-7pm. Calls to this number are charged at standard UK rates...O2 HomeIf you have O2 Home we will collect information from O2 Home devices like contact sensors, motion detectors and other sensor information. The information is used to send service notifications to you and other users you have nominated to use your O2 Home account.If you have cameras installed with O2 Home, the video clips and stills you choose to store will be encrypted and uploaded for storage on cloud servers where only you, or the users you have nominated can access it. We may however have information on how much cloud storage space you’ve used and when you’ve uploaded data.\xa0\xa0\xa0

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

", '
And some more:\xa0https://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/archive/promotions/2-months-free-o2-home-with-first-utility-...\xa0https://news.o2.co.uk/press-release/technophobia-prevents-brits-future-proofing-homes/\xa0https://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/archive/promotions/o2-home-jan-sale\xa0https://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/archive/promotions/o2-home-partners-discount-offer-january-2...\xa0https://www.o2.co.uk/termsandconditions/archive/other-products-and-services\xa0\xa0This last one still contains references to TuGo too, btw.\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

', '
The great overseer of website links is in the Bahamas where there is limited coverage and wifi. In fact he has emigrated around 10 years ago when all was well.....

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

', "
@jonsie\xa0wrote:The great overseer of website links is in the Bahamas where there is limited coverage and wifi. In fact he has emigrated around 10 years ago when all was well.....Times change, eh? Given the opportunity, I'd whisk off to the Bahamas too\xa0So no point reporting out-of-date pages any more here, you reckon?\xa0\xa0

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

", '
All the older members will recall the special Report Website Links thread a few years back. All a complete waste of time. The big problem is that in true O2 fashion, the website was redesigned around 6 or 7, maybe longer, years ago but only certain sections and the old website was, and still is, accessible. We all long since gave up reporting links.

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

', "
I reported on Friday that O2 Ask still isn't showing in the APP section and TU still is...:smileysad:

Veritas Numquam Perit

", "
Yep, there it is, in the red box below, @Cleoriff...\xa0Also I wonder if anyone here's likely to win the Big Tech Bundle they have plastered all over the O2 website (you can see it in the picture below as well, I have registered for it at least a gazillion times over the last few months, at a conservative estimate...!)\xa0

O2 Social Media(Twitter | Instagram | Facebook)

", "
That's exactly the picture I downloaded @pgn (though without your fancy artwork....) \xa0

Veritas Numquam Perit

", '
That’s funny as I even reported the pages over a month ago as well.\xa0The terms and condition page for me was pointing to a older version which as you no shouldn’t do that. \xa0That one is corrected now. Well it’s pointing to the new one at least, but as you pointed out, the others aren’t.\xa0I would have thought there would be a team all the time checking and browsing the o2 sites making sure everything is correct and up to date.\xa0\xa0

	Need Help, Just ask. We are one big Family here in the o2 Forum.Use iPhone XS Max dual sim, SE, Honor 10, IPad Pro 11, Apple Watch 4 LTE, 100+ Mpbs Barrier and a Record Player.
